thread.section_title: DC Inno | Washington DC Tech, City and Political News
thread.title: DC Inno Approved: Tech Events to Know About This Week
thread.title_full: DC Inno Approved: Tech Events to Know About This Week

author: Chris Bing
title: DC Inno Approved: Tech Events to Know About This Week
text:
share Credit: Flickr 
Here's what we've found for the best startup and tech networking events in the D.C. area to check out this week. Keep an eye out for the highlighted events, which are a sure bet for a great time. Monday, October 19 
Location: 1776 Crystal City, 2231 Crystal Dr #1000, Arlington, V.A. Date/Time: Monday, October 19, begins at 6 p.m. Event type: casual networking, product show & tell, info session Price: Free 
Come out Monday night for a vibrant discussion about how new technology projects can improve the state of local mass transportation. A number of topics including bike rental programs, smart software-enabled street grids and more will be talked about. Several local tech executives from companies like TransitScreen plan on showcasing some of the new tech products they have been working on as well. Doors open at 6:00; presentations start at 6:30 p.m. Tuesday, October 20 
Location: WeWork Wonder Bread Factory, 641 S Street NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Tuesday, October 20, from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. Event type: lecture, info-session, casual networking, presentations Price: Free 
Cybersecurity is a hot issue with major figures from Edward Snowden to U.S. Sen. John McCain raising concern about recent attacks. Get an expert take on what's next: join as national security innovation pros, TandemNSI, hosts speakers from the U.S. Naval Academy, U.S. Cyber Command, and Invincea's CEO Anup Ghosh to discuss the state of cybersecurity and how innovators and startups can help build the next big solution. 
Location: Chinatown WeWork, 718 7th Street NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Tuesday, October 20, from 6:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Event type: info-session, seminar, presentations, lecture, pro networking Price: $10 
Ryan Sears, the co-founder and CEO at SurveySnap, will lead a discussion about how to grow your startup from an early stage, while staying lean, into a profitable business. Topics of focus include brainstorming and research, business and customer modeling, how to effectively interview and outlining product interfaces. 
Location: MLK Library, 901 G St NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Tuesday, October 20, from 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. Event type: giant networking opportunity, casual pitch competition, presentations, Q&A Price: Free 
The DC tech community’s flagship monthly event arrives this Tuesday once again. Held at the MLK library in Chinatown, a short walk from the metro, DC Tech Meetup typically attracts nearly 500 attendees every event from various industries and businesses. If you’ve never been, this is a necessary event to get involved with if you want to know more about the local tech scene and the innovation that is occurring here in the District. Check it out. This month’s event will focus on presentations from startups active in the mobile software development space. Wednesday, October 21 
Location: DC Economic Partnership, 1495 F Street NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Wednesday, October 21, begins at 8 a.m. Event type: casual networking, pitch competition, presentations, Q&A Price: Free 
Grab a bagel, cup of coffee and start your day off right by getting to know some local startups that are making waves. TechBreakfast D.C. is back with some new presentations, founders and companies, to give you an early morning update on what’s going on in DC Tech. This week we have MDLegalApps, Cam-Built, Speak Agent and Spotluck, pitching the audience on their products and business plans. After the pitch portion, there will be an open Q&A for guests. 
Location: Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman, 1200 Seventeenth Street, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Wednesday, October 21, from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. Event type: seminar, 1-on-1 interview, fireside chat, casual networking, info-session Price: $20 
In a fireside chat with AOL executive William Pence, you’ll learn about the journey behind AOL and what it has taken to build out a major internet/media brand in the 21st century. Pence leads all aspects of AOL’s global technology strategy, platform development and external partnerships. Brian Park, Startup Grind regional director, will conduct the interview, which will conclude with an open Q&A from the crowd. Thursday, October 22 
Location: WeWork Dupont Circle, 1875 Connecticut Avenue NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Thursday, October 22, from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. Event type: seminar, lecture, presentation, info-session Price: Free 
You’ve likely heard or read something about lean startup practices, but Startup Central now wants you to come ready with all the questions you’ve been harboring for this informational Q&A-centric event. A panel of presenters/speakers will be available in a casual and open event to help answer questions based on their own personal experience building successful businesses. “This is a golden opportunity to get the individual attention you need, and a game plan on what to do next,” the event organizer writes. Weekend, October 24-25 
Location: GWU Elliott School of International Affairs, Room 113 1957 E Street NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Saturday, October 24, from 11 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Event type: brunch, casual networking, hackathon-style, pitch contest Price: Free 
The departments of labor and commerce in addition to the U. S. Geological Survey are partnering to host this data science event. Seven teams of D.C.-based data scientists have come together for a three month incubator and are now ready to present their findings, which work to improve projects spanning health, economics the environment. Enjoy a free brunch and get involved by helping the judges vote on a winner. Boom. All the tech news in D.C. you need to know.
